parameters.name: ClientToken
parameters.description: Client token used to ensure the idempotence of the request. Generate a parameter value from your client to ensure that it is unique across different requests. ClientToken supports only ASCII characters. Note: If you do not specify this, the system automatically uses the RequestId of the API request as the ClientToken identifier. Each API request has a different RequestId.

parameters.name: ConfigMode
parameters.description:
The configuration mode of the route target group. Supported modes:

- **Active-Standby**: Active-Standby mode.

parameters.name: RegionId
parameters.description: The region ID to which the route target group belongs. You can obtain the region ID by calling the DescribeRegions interface.

parameters.name: ResourceGroupId
parameters.description:
The resource group ID.

For more information about resource groups, see [What is a Resource Group](~~2381067~~).

parameters.name: RouteTargetGroupDescription
parameters.description:
The description of the route target group.

The description length must be between 1 and 256 characters, and cannot start with http:// or https://.

parameters.name: RouteTargetGroupName
parameters.description:
The name of the route target group.

The name length must be between 1 and 128 characters, and cannot start with http:// or https://.

parameters.name: RouteTargetMemberList
parameters.description:
The member list of the route target group.

In Active-Standby mode, the following restrictions apply to the members of the route target group:

1. The number of route target group members must be 2.
2. The route target group members must belong to different availability zones.

parameters.name: VpcId
parameters.description: The ID of the VPC to which the route target group belongs.
